snippet: According to Eduardo Sánchez, a spokesman for the Interior Ministry, the migrants were headed to the United States when they were swindled by smugglers along the border.
abstract: Mexican soldiers rescue 165 kidnapped migrants, mostly from Central America, from a house in northeastern state of Tamaulipas; migrants were headed to the United States when they were swindled by smugglers along the border.
lead_paragraph: According to Eduardo Sánchez, a spokesman for the Interior Ministry, the migrants were headed to the United States when they were swindled by smugglers along the border.

headline.main: Mexico: Army Rescues 165 Migrants Held by Kidnappers Near U.S. Border
headline.print_headline: Mexico: Army Rescues 165 Migrants Held by Kidnappers Near U.S. Border
